data.text: Introductory statement Mario Draghi to the press conference https://t.co/YFy1ydYNYb
Draghi: We have given plenty of evidence of ability to act independently, bound only by mandate of medium term infl. below but close to 2%
Draghi: Borrowing conditions for SMEs have improved and balance sheet repair has improved markedly over last few months
Draghi: Risk of deflation according to any measure has largely disappeared
Draghi: We will have to have a deep and careful analysis of situation but we are not there
Draghi: We didn't discuss tapering
Draghi: I'd rather comment on policies than just statements
Draghi: As the recovery firms up, real rates will go up too. Be patient.
Draghi: Recovery of whole euro zone is in everyone's interest, including Germany's
Draghi: Low interest rates are necessary now to get higher rates in the future
Draghi: Increasingly clear our policy stance has been successful
Draghi: We are confident about the smooth implementation of our asset purchase programme
Draghi: We define our inflation objective over the medium term, convergence has to be durable, sustained and across whole euro area
Draghi: Underlying inflation to rise more gradually in medium term supported by monetary policy, economic recovery and absorption of slack
Draghi: Near term headline inflation to pick up further due to movements in annual rates of change in energy prices
Draghi: No signs yet of convincing upward trend in underlying inflation
Draghi: Risks to euro area growth outlook tilted to downside due to global factors
Draghi: There are signs of a somewhat stronger global recovery
Draghi: Very favourable financing conditions and improvements in corporate profitability continue to promote recovery
Draghi: ECB to continue to look through changes in HICP if judged to be transient and no implication for medium term
Draghi: ECB monetary policy decisions of December 2016 have secured a sustained convergence towards inflation objective
Draghi: Further details of asset purchases below deposit facility interest rate under PSPP to be published at 15:30 CET
Draghi: APP purchases continue at €80 bn until end March and at €60 bn from April 2017 until end December 2017 or beyond if necessary
Draghi: Key ECB interest rates expected to remain at present or lower levels for extended time
